meanings.definition: A medical condition characterized by abnormal lateral curvature of the spine.
meanings.sent1: The doctor diagnosed the patient with scolioma after seeing the X-ray results.
meanings.sent2: She had to wear a back brace to help correct her scolioma.
meanings.sent3: The scolioma made him lean to one side, giving him a unique posture.
meanings.sent4: Her scolioma was like a winding road on a map, twisting unexpectedly.
meanings.sent5: The scolioma caused her spine to resemble the shape of a question mark.

meanings.sent1: The scolioma patient attended a support group to connect with others facing similar challenges.
meanings.sent2: He met a fellow scolioma at the physical therapy session.
meanings.sent3: The scolioma in the waiting room struck up a conversation about their shared experiences.
meanings.sent4: She felt relieved to find a community of scoliomas who understood her struggles.
meanings.sent5: The scolioma shared tips on managing daily activities with others in the group.
